quoteLast: the Iowa's forward twelve-inch guns thundered out at the sleeping hills, and for fourteen minutes they poured starboard broadsides on the coast. Meanwhile the Indiana, the New York, and other ships repeated the dose from the rear.
title: Our War with Spain for Cuba's Freedom
author: White, Trumbull, 1868-1941

quoteFirst: “Yes. Well, his train was to go at
quoteLast: , and he asked me in the most meaning tone if I cared sufficiently to hear something he had to say to get up early enough to see him off. I—I said I did.”
title: The Teacup Club
author: Bengough, Elisa Armstrong, -1929

quoteFirst: It has long appeared to me that two sentences in Sir Ian’s dispatch suggest a more probable explanation. As quoted above, he says the orders were for the bombardment to be switched on to the flanks and reverse slopes of the heights at
quoteLast: He further says that the Gurkhas and South Lancashires, after reaching the crest, “began to attack down the far side of it,” _i.e._ down the reverse slopes of the hill.
title: The Dardanelles campaign
author: Nevinson, Henry Woodd, 1856-1941

quoteFirst: For a reverse slope, mortars or howitzers are wanted. There were howitzers near No. 2 Post and along the flats beside the shore, and their orders were to bombard the reverse slope after
quoteLast: This explanation is suggested, but the controversy will be forgotten before settled.
title: The Dardanelles campaign
author: Nevinson, Henry Woodd, 1856-1941

title: The Dardanelles campaign

quoteFirst: "At four, coffee was given to all the men and at fifteen minutes to five, the shore batteries had shells dropping all around, but we did not fire until
quoteLast: . The Spanish fleet was in sight off the navy yard. Then the fight started in earnest. For a while I thought my time had come.
title: Young Peoples' History of the War with Spain
author: Holmes, Prescott
